title: Local obituary: Accursio ‘Gus’ Sanfilippo, 55, Gloucester fisherman and captain of the Lily Jean
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Accursio 'Gus' Sanfilippo, 55, Gloucester fisherman, passed away at sea on January 30, 2026.
Sanfilippo was captain of the F/V Lily Jean and dedicated over 40 years to dory racing.
He is survived by his wife Lorie, two children, and many family members; funeral services planned in Gloucester.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about this week’s weather, including Tuesday’s snow
author: John Waller
bullets: Snow expected Tuesday evening in Southern New England with accumulations of 1-3 inches, 3-6 inches possible near Route 2.
Dry conditions with breezy winds today; temperatures to moderate by Tuesday with mixed precipitation possible on the south coast.
Sub-zero wind chills reported this morning; highs approaching 30Â°F expected this afternoon in Boston.

title: Should you be worried about your roof this winter?
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Experts highlight ice dams as a key concern for older pitched roofs during New England winters.
Roofs are designed to carry snow loads, with modern roofs meeting high wind standards up to 130 mph.
Ice dam prevention involves using self-adhering products but workmanship impacts effectiveness.

title: 4 maps predicting Tuesday snowfall totals
author: John Waller
bullets: Boston meteorologists predict 1-3 inches of snow for Tuesday afternoon into the night.
NWS and WCVB suggest a 3-6 inch snowfall possible over the North Shore within 24 hours.
Snow cleanup is expected to extend into Wednesday in Boston as reported by Boston 25 News.

title: ‘I just feel numb’: Inside the Patriots’ locker room after a crushing Super Bowl defeat
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots suffer a 29-13 defeat to the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara.
Despite the loss, Patriots players expressed pride in their season, citing strong team culture and overachievement.
Quarterback Drake Maye played through a shoulder injury requiring a pain-killing shot, affecting offensive performance.

title: The 2025 Patriots season was a success. You can still feel sick about its ending.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots lost to the Seattle Seahawks 29-13 in Super Bowl LX.
Quarterback Drake Maye struggled with three turnovers, while the Patriots' offensive line allowed six sacks.
Despite the loss, the Patriots' season exceeded expectations with coach Mike Vrabel and quarterback Maye leading a promising future.

title: A 1788 Rhode Island home that houses the ‘oldest gingerbread ovens in America’ for $754k
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: A 1788 home in Kingston, Rhode Island, featuring the oldest gingerbread ovens in America, is listed for $754,000.
The 1,803-square-foot property includes three bedrooms, one-and-a-half baths, and original features like wide-plank floors and five fireplaces.
The home, called the 'Gem at Little Rest,' has updated electric, plumbing, major systems, and is located on 18th-century stone-walled grounds.

title: Drake Maye admits he needed pain-killing shot for shoulder injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye received a pain-killing injection in his right shoulder before Super Bowl LX against Seattle.
Maye initially injured his shoulder during the AFC Championship Game against Denver on January 25, 2026.
Despite the injury, Maye completed 27 of 43 passes for 295 yards, two touchdowns, and two interceptions in the loss.

title: What Mike Vrabel had to say about the Patriots after Super Bowl LX loss
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel refused to solely blame quarterback Drake Maye for the Patriots' 29-13 Super Bowl LX loss to the Seahawks.
Vrabel emphasized the importance of both the coaching staff and execution in addressing the team's performance issues.
Vrabel acknowledged the challenge of Super Bowl losses, focusing on improvement and maintaining strong relationships moving forward.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in Super Bowl loss to Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez and Craig Woodson were defensive standouts for the Patriots despite the Super Bowl loss.
The Patriots' offensive line struggles led to Drake Maye being sacked six times by the Seahawks defense.
Seattle's Kenneth Walker III earned Super Bowl MVP honors by exploiting New England's run defense for significant gains.
